message: how can i do that
I want to create a copy of somejson with a different value2

let's say I have declared this in a prelude:
somejson = { "key":{"subkey":value, "subkey2":value2}};
method 3 :  I guess that if value2 is not a string you need to use value2.encoded() in the replace. Also there might be a problem if there are several occurrences of value2 in the json
so I'd suggest :
method 3: str=sj1.encode().replace(re/value2/, "newvalue2"); sj2=str.decode();
method 1 : after having a look at stackoverflow, I'd conclude that it is insanely complex if feasible at all
@rsbohn thank you Randall !! Your knowledge of KRL tricks shows that we probably need a new operator or a function that allows us to do that easily.
how do u iterate in krl
method 1: iterate over (key,value) copy all but the one you want to change.
method 2: remove subkey2, add a new subkey2 -- this may involve sj2=sj1.pick(); sj3=sj2.?remove?()... (yuck?)
u said it, there is no remove in KRL
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5362965/what-is-the-best-way-to-iterate-over-a-hash-in-krl
method 4 : bother Sam until he invents some magic json spell
I won't emphasize that in javascript you do that with one line of code.
